result.execSummary:
The defendant Floyd Lee Poe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Consecutive to: to any other sentence, STRAIGHT TIME.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Floyd Lee Poe

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1:

The Court ordered defendant to serve 120 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 14 (fourteen) days time served, STRAIGHT TIME. 

Court ordered defendant to pay all mandatory court costs and fees by August 19, 2016, or to be docketed as a civil judgment. Court ordered all non-mandatory (waivable) costs waived.

Court ordered restitution set at $0 (zero).

BRANCH 37 (HONORABLE JUDGE T. CHRISTOPHER DEE) FOR BRANCH 24 (HONORABLE JUDGE PROTASIEWICZ)

Defendant Floyd Lee Poe in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Defendant Floyd Lee Poe in custody.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

AS TO COUNT 1:

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.
from Defendant requesting PR bond received and filed.

Attorney Danielle L. Shelton in court, defendant Floyd Lee Poe not in court, in custody and not produced.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Defense counsel waived defendant's appearance for today's proceedings. Defense counsel has received discovery and offer, awaiting additional discovery and state does not have the file.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Sunglass Hut and Mayfair Mall

Defendant Floyd Lee Poe in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Defendant Floyd Lee Poe in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
